personal.name: Muhammad Kamal
personal.title: Senior Backend Engineer | Python • Django • Scalable Systems
personal.bio: Senior Backend Engineer with 4+ years of experience building and scaling backend systems in production. Specialized in Python, Django/DRF, PostgreSQL, AWS, and event-driven architectures. Strong experience in system design, performance optimization, zero-downtime migrations, and CI/CD. Proven ability to own backend services end-to-end in data-intensive, production-critical environments.

responsibilities: Owned multiple backend services in production, including deployments, monitoring, incident resolution, and mentoring junior engineers
Designed and evolved REST APIs and internal services using Python and Django/DRF supporting thousands of daily active users
Reduced critical API latency by 40% by redesigning PostgreSQL indexes, query plans, and Redis caching strategy
Executed zero-downtime PostgreSQL migrations involving millions of rows while maintaining data integrity
Built and maintained CI/CD pipelines using Git, Docker, and AWS, reducing deployment failures by ~30%
Implemented observability using Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, and CloudWatch to detect and resolve production issues early
Independently handled production incidents, bug fixes, and performance issues in a remote contract setup
Designed and deployed backend APIs using Python, Flask, and MySQL for production systems
Improved slow-performing endpoints by 80–90% through query optimization and backend refactoring
Added automated tests and service documentation to improve long-term maintainability
Built and integrated backend APIs for payment gateway systems interacting with financial institutions
Contributed to high-availability payment services handling sensitive financial transactions in a regulated environment
Collaborated with frontend and DevOps teams to deliver production releases using Docker and PostgreSQL
Developed backend systems using Django REST Framework and PostgreSQL for complex business workflows
Implemented real-time features using Django Channels and Kafka
Designed APIs, database schemas, and containerized deployments using Docker
Worked on search functionality using Elasticsearch for large datasets
Designed event-driven workflows using Kafka and RabbitMQ, making architectural trade-offs between synchronous APIs and async pipelines based on consistency, latency, and failure modes
Developed backend services using Django and Django REST Framework
Designed relational database schemas and optimized SQL queries
Applied OOP principles to build maintainable backend codebases

projects.name: Synctoon
projects.description: Production-ready open-source AI-powered 2D animation tool that converts text scripts and audio into complete animated videos with automated lip-sync, expressions, and frame-based rendering.
highlights: Built to automate animation workflows for educators, storytellers, and content creators
Designed full animation pipeline from text/audio analysis to final video rendering
Actively used in demos and adopted by early users

projects.name: PostgreSQL Data Migrator
projects.description: Python-based database migration toolkit built to safely migrate production PostgreSQL databases across environments with minimal downtime.
highlights: Supports schema reflection, bulk transfers, and deferred constraints
Built to handle large datasets and complex schemas
Used internally across multiple projects for safe data migrations

projects.name: Local-to-Internet Tunnel
projects.description: Lightweight DevOps utility to expose local backend services to the internet using Cloudflare tunnels.
highlights: Built to simplify webhook testing and remote collaboration
Auto-detects local servers and generates public URLs instantly
Free alternative to ngrok for backend developers

education.details: Focus on software engineering, backend systems, and databases
